instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..

threads.title: Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shuts down after half chime.
threads.message: Need help with one more board. <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with slight liquid damage around <CHIP>U8005</CHIP> and <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>. Machine gives a chime and shuts off immediately. In fact itâ€™s just half a chime and it shuts off. After cleaning liquid damage, I get a fan spin but it shuts down after few minutes. <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> is at 5.11v when it starts and drops to 0v and machine stops. Any suggestions?

threads.title: Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shuts down after half chime.
threads.message:
Do you still get chime?
What about image/backlight and USB activity in these minutes?

Try starting in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shuts down after half chime.
threads.message: Sorry. I just sorted it. It seems the SSD has a problem. It works fine without SSD so i replaced it and it booted up and works fine. Thank u. By the way i am am new at this and would love to learn how to use SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shuts down after half chime.
threads.message:
You should always try Google first.

[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.google.com/search?client=firefox-b-d&bih=866&biw=1680&hl=es&sxsrf=ALeKk03zmTKU3u94VvTM5Hk-o3W7cvqOIA%3A1598605749358&ei=tclIX76mFZeejLsP1ZC2uA4&q=boot+in+smc+bypass+mode&oq=boot+in+smc+bypass+mode&gs_lcp=CgZwc3ktYWIQAzoECCMQJ1DK1gFYld0BYJDgAWgAcAB4AIABY4gB4ASSAQE3mAEAoAEBqgEHZ3dzLXdpesABAQ&sclient=psy-ab&ved=0ahUKEwj-1M2-xr3rAhUXD2MBHVWIDecQ4dUDCAw&uact=5[/URL]

It is also explained on many threads of the forum.
You can save time in this way...

threads.title: Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shuts down after half chime.
threads.message:
Got it booting and running but now stuck at no backlight. Confirmed dim apple logo and password screen is also visible but dark and no backlight. Liquid damage and minor corrosion seen around <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>. Cleaned it but no luck. 8.57v on fuse and on backlight output. 

Measure the VIN voltage through capacitor <CAPACITOR>C7710</CAPACITOR>, the value is 5V, Measure the VDDIO voltage through capacitor <CAPACITOR>C7711</CAPACITOR>, the value is 3.3V, Measure the EN Pin voltage at the 2 Pin of the resistor <RESISTOR>R7731</RESISTOR>, the value is 2.8V, Measure the PWM Pin voltage at the 2 Pin of the resistor <RESISTOR>R7704</RESISTOR> , the value is 2.29V, Measure the SCLK voltage at the 2 Pin of the resistor <RESISTOR>R7753</RESISTOR> , the value is 3.3V, Measure the SDA voltage at the 2 Pin of the resistor <RESISTOR>R7757</RESISTOR> , the value is 3.3V. 

All voltages seem ok except PWM which should be 2.8v but shows 2.29v. Should i replace <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> or can you suggest any other checks.

threads.title: Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shuts down after half chime.
threads.message:
"All voltages seem ok except PWM which should be 2.8v but shows 2.29v."
Do NOT make wrong assumptions so easy!
There is PWM signal and varies with the brightness level.

Did you check XW7720?
If OK, change <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>.
I bet A5 ball is corroded...

threads.title: Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shuts down after half chime.
threads.message: Feedback line trace is also ok. Will change <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> and check.

threads.title: Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shuts down after half chime.
threads.message: Loads of corrosion under <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>. Cleaned and replaced <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>. Backlight working and all is well. Thank you.
